entry.title: [css-anchor-position] scroll-adjust for inset-area
entry.content:
The OOF layout result needs marking for scroll adjustments when

anchor() queries apply. This is done by propagating this information

from the evaluator. Since inset-area also relies on anchor alignment,

we need to propagate such adjustments from the evaluator used for

computing the modified containing block for inset-area too.

entry.title: [Uno-d] Enable account storage for addresses by default with explicit signin
entry.content:
Before this CL, account storage for kAutofill was enabled by default

when `kSyncEnableContactInfoDataTypeInTransportMode` was enabled on

desktop.

After this CL, it also requires the extra conditions:

- the signin was explicit

- the project phase is "kFull".



In particular account storage for kAutofill won't be enabled for:

- users in the experimental phase

- users who have signed in through a Dice automatic flow.



This change of behavior does not impact any actual users, because

`kSyncEnableContactInfoDataTypeInTransportMode` was never enabled.

This CL is a requirement for the launch of

`kSyncEnableContactInfoDataTypeInTransportMode`, as it enables a

migration.



Fixed: b/324412583

Change-Id: I9b85b09e3864f3989d159194055fb563f4d8e65b

entry.title: [accessibility] Stop application of mode flags to guests' frames
entry.content:
Only send AXMode updates to RenderFrameHosts that belong to the

WebContents for which SetAccessibilityMode is called. This fixes a bug

whereby RenderFrameHosts belonging to an inner WebContents were told to

update their accessibility mode twice. While the second call did not

trigger new computation in the renderer, it did bump the reset token,

causing the browser to racily ignore some messages from the renderer.



This deflakes some PDF accessibility tests, eliminating DCHECK failures

stemming from lost updates in the browser and timeouts.



Bug: 40928791

Change-Id: I8fe3c5a7112299acb5ee8a81bb8382e2ed767894

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2VEA: Stop device poll only if V4L2Device is opened
entry.content:
The V4L2VEA destructor executes StopDevicePoll() and it invokes the

poll thread interruption. It fails if V4L2Device is not Open()ed

because the poll file descriptor is invalid (-1).

This CL prevents the unnecessary poll interruption, so no false error

log of StopDevicePoll fatal is output.

entry.title: [Blink] Have CanvasResource get texture target via ClientSharedImage
entry.content:
This CL updates CanvasResource to get the texture target via the

SharedImage that it creates rather than via

gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget(). The change is a behavioral no-op due to

the following:



* The BufferFormat that CanvasResource currently passes to

gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget() is computed from the SharedImageFormat

that it supplies to the SharedImage

* The texture target is currently defaulted to GL_TEXTURE_2D and changed

only if the SharedImage is an overlay candidate, which is defined as

the SI usage flags including SCANOUT usage or on Mac only WebGPU

usage. The ClientSI that this class creates is passed those

same SI usage flags. ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(BufferUsage)

will return GL_TEXTURE_2D if the SI does not have any of these usages,

while if it does have one of these usages it will call through to

gpu::GetBufferTextureTarget().



NOTE: A more ambitious refactoring would look to get rid of

CanvasResource::texture_target_ and even

CanvasResource::GetTextureTarget() in favor of pushing out computation

of the texture target to sites where it is actually needed. That work is

out of scope of this CL.



Bug: 41494843

Change-Id: I22d26a6252d0b194a1b8b3c8c8523796b2208bf8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331785

Reviewed-by: Vasiliy Telezhnikov

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Reviewed-by: Kentaro Hara

entry.title: Reland #2 "Privacy Guide: remove search suggestions and preload cards"
entry.content:
This is attempt #2 to reland this cleanup. Earlier attempts:

commit 1faae6bd62538e3f685c7143d003a05dd5fbfffa and

commit 01170d74d06655cd7244026dc0689542702c9bc2.

This is created as a revert-of-a-revert as Gerrit currently doesn't

allow to create a reland with merge conflicts (crbug.com/41395970).



The position of the cookie step that is shown in the PG flow in the

3PCD-disabled codepath has been updated in the integration test (see

delta of patchset 1>2) which should (hopefully) make it pass also on

waterfall bots.



The reason why this wasn't caught in the last 2 CLs seems to stem

from how 3PCD is tested in privacy_guide_integration_test.ts:

privacy_guide_integration_test.ts does not force the 3PCD state to

test both possible codepaths, but instead relies on the

fieldtrial_testing_configs to run both possible 3PCD code paths [1].

Contrary to our earlier understanding it seems that on local builds

and on CQ bots, the fieldtrial_testing_configs does not actually run

both possible 3PCD code paths, but only the 3PCD-enabled code path.

As the cookie step is shown in PG only in the 3PCD-disabled code path,

as a result of that code path seemingly not being tested in local builds

and in CQ bots, the incorrect position of the cookie step in the

integration test was not caught in the last 2 CLs.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5014485/comment/6a847c98_64081fc3/



Original change's description:

> Privacy Guide: clean up search suggestions and preload cards

>

> The product decision has been made that the "improve search

> suggestions" and "preload" cards in privacy guide won't launch. This

> CL removes those cards from privacy guide.

>

> Bug: 40184479

> Change-Id: I747c2c693ca624d769290c2351d02d4c0913bdab

entry.title: Introduce PlusAddressAllocator.
entry.content:
This CL introduces an abstraction around allocation new plus addresses.

This abstraction has two goals:

1) Separating out allocation logic from PlusAddressService as it becomes

more complex (e.g., refreshes, origin-specific refresh limits).

2) Providing an interface that can have multiple implementations.

Eventually, there will likely be a second implementation that

pre-allocates plus addresses instead of allocating them just in time.



Functionally, this CL is a no-op.



Bug: 324557932

Change-Id: I918b834568bb43f88b266e5bda64dddd2ce0ed16

entry.title: Reland "Split read and write in ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 71a486e130f369c12f05b0be4385bf7580edc43d.

As another reland crrev.com/c/5331919 was submitted first, this CL was

manually created with resolving conflicts. The main diff from the

original CL is following:

1. RaceNetworkRequestReadBufferManager::RemainingBuffer() return the

subspan of the buffer, which only return the actual remaining size.

2. Removed CHECK(state.peer_closed()); in

ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient::Read(). It seems that

`state.peer_closed()` is not always true. Will check in detail by adding

crash keys, but maybe the caller doesn't have to care about the peer

status after reading data.





Original change's description:

> Split read and write in ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient

>

> This CL removes `ReadAndWrite()` and `ReadAndTwoPhaseWrite()`, and

> updates to call `Read()` and `Write()` (or, `TwoPhaseWrite()`)

> separately.

>

> After this CL, the read operation is called only when the read data pipe

> becomes readable (or the peer closed), and the write data pipe becomes

> writable. This would improve the code base that mojo data pipe APIs to

> be called in an appropriate timing.

>

> Also this CL updates `RaceNetworkRequestReadBufferManager::ReadData()`

> to be called only when the remaining unconsumed buffer does not exist

> for the simplicity.

>

> Bug: 40943349

> Change-Id: I78495ff75f96e7306f3920843b5ec3be24ea2d7d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5332231

> Reviewed-by: Yoshisato Yanagisawa

> Commit-Queue: Shunya Shishido

> Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266937}

entry.title: [URL] Enable setting a host, port, or pathname on non-special URLs
entry.content:
This CL, a follow-up to https://crrev.com/c/5276359, allows Web facing

URL APIs to set a host, port, or pathname, on non-special URLs.



This functionality was previously available for internal URL structures

through prior CLs, but not exposed to JS APIs.



The CL updates KURL::IsHierarchical() to recognize non-special URLs as

hierarchical and introduces KURL::CanRemoveHost() to handle an empty

host correctly.



Maintaining the current behavior with the feature flag disabled while

introducing these changes might slightly impact code readability,

unfortunately.



Examples:



Before:



> const url = new URL("git://h/")

> url.host = "";

> url.href

"git://h/"



After:



> const url = new URL("git://h/")

> url.host = "";

> url.href

"git:///"



Before:



> const url = new URL("git://h/");

> url.port = 80;

> url.href

"git://h/"



After:



> const url = new URL("git://h/")

> url.port = 80;

> url.href

"git://h:80/"



Note: Setting an empty host is disallowed when a port exists, as

follows:



> const url = new URL("git://h:80/")

> url.host = "";

> url.href

"git://h:80/"



Tests:



The WPT url tests has a good coverage of these test cases. Many

previously failing tests are now passing.



Some tests involving `pathname` are still failing. These failures occur

because `pathname` processing should differ between special and

non-special URLs. That will be addressed in a separate follow-up CL.





Bug: 40063064

Change-Id: I0d71921edfa5f13ae60b8ce7ea8117d5fdeef7de

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318947

Commit-Queue: Hayato Ito

Reviewed-by: Timothy Gu

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268290}

entry.title: oak birch: add menu model adapter for birch bar
entry.content:
This cl added a new menu model adapter for BirchBarContextMenuModel.



BirchBarMenuModel helps add two customized menu items. One is for

"Show Suggestions" option that needs a switch button at the end and

the other is for customized suggestion items that need a checkbox

in front.



Adding switch button is simple that we only need to attach the button

at the end of current MenuItemView.



However, adding checkbox is tricky since MenuItemView will align all

newly added children to the right of item label. To solve this issue,

we should add a checkbox with the label text to the MenuItemView and

remove the label of MenuItemView by explicitly set an empty title.

In addition, MenuItemView with only one child will be treated as a

container and the container margins will be added to the item. To

remove the margins, we should set the vertical margins to 0.



Bug: b:326256018

Change-Id: I0c09fe1f65a6102f0fdf68902af207dd167ac206

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5329935

entry.title: Ensure MV3 extensions in lacros do not register for ash
entry.content:
QuickOffice changed in crrev.com/c/5335880 to use MV3 (previuosly V2).

This causes DCHECKs in AppService to fail when QO is registered as

AppType kExtension by ash, and AppType kStandaloneBrowserExtension by

lacros.



We must fix the ordering of ExtensionAppsChromeOs::Accepts() so that

extensions in lacros are ignored even if they are MV3. The check added

in crrev.com/c/4108599 needs to be moved after ash-lacros checks.

entry.title: Re-do close watcher user activation tracking
entry.content:
Our previous approach for close watcher user activation tracking had

cases where we could allow the cancel event to fire, but we were not

allowing it.



Fixing this is nontrivial. We need to more closely track the allowed

number of close watchers, and use it when making decisions about

creating ungrouped close watchers or firing cancel events. This allows

us to pass test cases like:



* A close watcher stack that is relatively empty compared to the amount

of user activations so far, needs to allow cancel events.



* A close watcher stack that is full compared to the amount of user

activations so far, needs to prevent cancel events.



Additionally, our previous mechanism of tracking groups by using

booleans on the close watchers was buggy when a close watcher was

destroyed. Instead, properly track the groups as a vector of vectors.



Spec PR: https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10168



Bug: 1512224

Change-Id: I6d7ccdc27c69f457455f517dcdbcc71d615b4290

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5232387

Reviewed-by: Joey Arhar

entry.title: Handle initialize failure with Skia/Graphite/Dawn
entry.content:
If Dawn initialization fails when GPU process is supposed to be using

Graphite/Dawn then the process is not usable since nothing can be drawn.

When this happens, trigger the GPU process initialization failure path.

This will cause the GPU process to restart and the browser process to

initiate fallback to the next best GPU mode.



The creation of DawnContextProvider is moved earlier to GpuInit. That

code is where most of the existing graphics API initialization happens

so initializing dawn there allows reusing the same GPU process

initialization failed code.



Bug: 325000752

entry.title: [bfcache] Send source location to renderer side for NRR API
entry.content:
This CL is to send JavaScript source locations (i.e. url, function name, line number, column number) of BFCache blocking reasons to a web local frame from the browser side.



Before this CL, back_forward_cache_impl.cc was sending only the strings of reasons without source location.



This CL creates a new map `reason_to_source` that saves all the reasons in a format ready to be reported in NRR API, and their source location (if any). It replaces `GetStringReasons()` in back_forward_cache_impl.cc, and send source location to the renderer.



In the future, we will expose the reasons' source locations to the NotRestoredReasons API, and update WPTs.

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Remove unused legacy image processor code
entry.content:
The encoder uses an ImageProcessor, |image_processor_|, which is created

by an ImageProcessorFactory::Create() call. As a result,

|image_processor_| is always created with IMPORT output mode. There is

no reason to keep the ALLOCATE code branch when calling

ImageProcessor::Process().



Removing this code path unblocks removal of the legacy ImageProcessor

VideoFrame functions. All other usage of the legacy ImageProcessor

functions is done with FrameResource, not VideoFrame.



This also removes VideoFrame wrapping for frames that are output from

the image processor and are passed to the encoder. Typically, wrapping a

frame allows for the wrapping frame to have different metadata,

timestamp, visible area, and natural size. The encoder doesn't use any

of these features.



Bug: b:277581596

Test: VEA tests pass on Cherry, Trogdor.

Change-Id: I4db95a0acca92ba7dd9019bf7efe774b95a0eb87

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5271764

entry.title: Revert "Prepare Abseil for using flags in test-only binaries."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7bcca16fb55af7eda30e516270390b24527f3e8e.



Reason for revert: fix centipede, since everything else has been reverted anyway



Original change's description:

> Prepare Abseil for using flags in test-only binaries.

>

> In component builds, //third_party/abseil-cpp:absl directly includes

> the additional targets for flags support.

>

> However, in non-component builds, flags support is built into a separate

> static library. This has several advantages for Chrome:

> - absl_flags is marked as testonly, so non-test binaries cannot use it.

> - it prevents absl_flags static initializers from being included in

> non-test binaries.

> - it will allow the gn check exception for GoogleTest to be removed in

> a followup

>

> The main disadvantage is that test infrastructure that uses absl flags

> needs to add an additional dependency in component builds.

>

> Bug: 326607005

> Change-Id: Ied0c31d40ea900fe73f89a872dc6c86614b16baf

entry.title: Revert "Re-enable Abseil flags support in GoogleTest."
entry.content:
This reverts commit aa3936064e4896c948b8e82351a47b5d107fc6fe.



Reason for revert: suspect causing tests failures on Linux Tests (Dbg)(1).

- content_unittests failed.

- browser_tests failed.

- device_unittests failed.



First build failure:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(dbg)(1)/119054/overview



Sample log:

ERROR: Flag 'gmock_catch_leaked_mocks' was defined more than once but with differing types. Defined in files '../../third_party/googletest/src/googlemock/src/gmock.cc' and '../../third_party/googletest/src/googlemock/src/gmock.cc'.



Original change's description:

> Re-enable Abseil flags support in GoogleTest.

>

> While Abseil now supports a GTEST_NO_ABSL_FLAGS define, and Chrome could

> simply set that define (once the corresponding GoogleTest version is

> rolled in), there are other third-party test projects that need to use

> parts of Abseil not normally allowed in Chrome, e.g. fuzztest's

> Centipede. This serves as a proof-of-concept to validate the overall

> approach.

>

> Bug: 326607005

> Bug: 40286621

entry.title: pine: Retrieves necessary data from session restore for ash
entry.content:
For ash builds, query session restore and then packages the data

we are interested and send it over to ash. The ash side code will then

fetch the favicons using an existing mojo/delegate API.



The data we are interested in is the tab title, tab urls and app name.

For PWAs, the appID saved is the chrome appID, we use session restore

to get the app name, and then remove __crx__ prefix, so we can then

query the app service for the icon and app name.



More info and links in the linked bug.



Test: manual

Test: browser_tests PineBrowserTest.TabInfo

entry.title: Allow snapshot in overview mode for lacros windows
entry.content:
This CL allows snapshot in overview mode for lacros windows. This means

occlusion will be paused during overview enter and exit animation, which

improves performance. We will keep the code supporting disabling

snapshot support until we determine it's fine for overview mode to show

lacros snapshots, since lacros may behave worse than ash here.

entry.title: [headless] Force --screenshot command image size if --window-size
entry.content:
Old headless users commonly use --window-size switch to specify

screenshot size and this works because old headless has no chrome

around web contents and browser window size effectively defines

the resulting screenshot size.



With new headless this does not work because Chrome has tab strip

and omnibox at the top of the browser window, so screenshot vertical

size is typically smaller than expected.



This CL forces screenshot size to be the same as requested by

--window-size switch if it is present.

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Implement redirect for obsolete routes in revamp
entry.content:
When the OsSettingsRevampWayfinding feature flag is enabled, some routes

and their respective pages become obsolete. For example, the

/accountManager route and subpage do not exist under the revamp because

the account manager settings are up-leveled to the top-level accounts

page in this case. This CL implements redirects as a "catch-all"

solution to handle obsolete paths. Subsequent CLs will address updating

the obsolete paths to their new paths from the external UI surfaces.

Revamp disabled: http://shortn/_g8bcTI0zEF

entry.title: [remoting host] Fix bug with state not updated in NegotiatingAuthenticatorBase
entry.content:
NegotiatingAuthenticatorBase tracks its own state and the current

implementation of NotifyStateChangeAfterAccepted() does not update the

state of the negotiating authenticator, so the caller would still see

`state() == ACCEPTED` in the state-change-after-accepted callback. This

crashes the host whenever the SessionAuthz reauth process fails.



This CL fixes this by overriding NotifyStateChangeAfterAccepted() so

that it updates the authenticator state as well as the rejection reason.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Use SimulateMouseClickAt() for context menu printing tests
entry.content:
Use PDFExtensionTestBase::SimulateMouseClickAt() instead of

content::RenderWidgetHost::ShowContextMenuAtPoint() to open the context

menu.



ShowContextMenuAtPoint() may be a flakier way to open the context menu,

so try using SimulateMouseClickAt(), which many more tests use.

Re-enable the disabled tests.



This allows the OOPIF PDF version of

PDFExtensionPrintingTest.ContextMenuPrintCommandExtensionMainFrame to

run, as it used to time out without a context menu opening.



Bug: 40283511, 40853003, 324636880

This creates a prototype gesture settings subpage that includes

several action to gesture mappings, including gestures for

left-click, right-click, recenter cursor, and start dictation.



The UX for this feature is still very much in flux, and it's

not clear whether we'll allow multiple gestures to be mapped to

a single action (likely), how the interface will look, and

what actions are available.

feature flag.

entry.title: [A11y] Batch deferred event processing, not just serialization
entry.content:
This is a minor performance improvement when there are many of the

same type of change on the same node. This helps pave the way for future

CLs that will de-dupe the same types of change on the same node within

a givien period of time, e.g. scrolling or animations.



This means that we need to be able to determine whether serialization

should be immediate before an event was generated during the deferred

event processing. Fortunately, we can use the TreeUpdateReason to help.



Bug: none

Change-Id: If95c72f1e493c9b271191efaca19efd8afddb603

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5288495

Reviewed-by: Chris Harrelson

Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268178}

entry.title: [Extensions c2s] Restore previous access when toggling extension on
entry.content:
Restore to previous granted site access in the extensions menu when

toggling extension site access on. For this, we add a set that stores

the extensions whose site access was withheld using the extensions

menu and previously had broad site access.



We only take into account site access changes made in the extensions

menu. An extension's site access could be changed elsewhere (e.g

chrome://extensions) but wouldn't be added/removed to/from this set.

This is ok, since the main goal is to represent the last explicit state

in the extensions menu.



We store the set in the PermissionsManager, since we only restore

previous access for the duration of the session.



Screencast: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-e7HFZYSrnwdBZfoMQOat7HwUdzPw2D6/view?usp=sharing



Bug: 40879945

entry.title: Introduce forced colors state as a Web Setting
entry.content:
This CL introduces the forced colors state in the renderer to exist

as a web setting. Currently, the forced colors state in the renderer

process is sourced from the global NativeTheme web instance and cached

in the Document. With the page colors feature, it is important to

ensure the forced colors state exist as a web setting similar to

preferred_color_scheme and preferred_contrast. Because web settings are

not global like the NativeTheme, moving the state will enable the

block list feature which allows users opt out of forced colors mode

for specific sites that are unusable with it.



Additionally, making the forced colors state a web setting, will

address https://crbug.com/41489514, where the ColorSchemeHelper class

doesn't ensure proper clean up of the forced colors state because it

is cached directly in the Document.



Bug: 1231644, 41489514

Change-Id: I20283485b91f4b3169e0bad72f4cfe8bd02b770f

entry.title: serial: Delay GetDevices until after initial enumeration
entry.content:
SerialPortManagerImpl::GetDevices combines serial ports

from SerialDeviceEnumerator (non-Bluetooth enumerator) and

BluetoothSerialDeviceEnumerator (Bluetooth enumerator).



The non-Bluetooth enumerator can synchronously enumerate

its serial ports, but the Bluetooth enumerator initially

does not enumerate any ports because it must access the

BluetoothAdapter on a specific sequence. This causes

clients to receive no Bluetooth serial ports the first

time navigator.serial.getPorts is called.



This CL introduces a new method

GetDevicesAfterInitialEnumeration that will wait until after

the initial enumeration is complete before returning ports.

The port manager's GetDevices method is updated to use this

new method.



The new method replaces OnGotAdapterForTesting which was used

in tests to detect when the initial enumeration is complete.



Additionally, the base::test::ScopedFeatureList is

removed from tests since the relevant base::Feature is now

default-enabled.



Bug: 324139241

Change-Id: I7ebc7cb46d575bf9e4dc8349726e4244b9284eab

entry.title: utr: Prompt the user about warnings if the recipe suggests re-running
entry.content:
The UTR recipe will check the local checkout/machine, and raise a

warning if it doesn't match what the builder would expect. With this CL,

the script will print this warning and ask the user if they want

to proceed despite the mismatch. eg:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/46VBtPSu285uDiQ



If the user enters Y, the recipe will re-run itself and bypass the

check that threw that warning. If the user enters anything else, the

script will quit and fail.



Bug: 41492688

entry.title: Rename WebSocketExtension::Equals to Equivalent
entry.content:
The method WebSocketExtension::Equals considers two objects equal even

if the order of keys differs, so Equivalent is a better name.



Also re-implement it with `stable_sort` instead of `multimap` to reduce

the number of allocations needed.



Also replace the WebSocketExtension::Parameter::Equals() method with a

compiler-generated operator==.

entry.title: Stop modifying author provided selection colors
entry.content:
CSS Issue https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/6150 was

resolved to require that browsers respect the author provided

colors in ::selection pseudos. Make the change.



Tested in unit tests and a WPT. Note that the default behavior

is not changed: chromium will still invert the color if the

text color matches the default selection highlight color.



Note the Mac layout theme was changed to return a non-transparent

color when the platform color is unavailable.



Bug: 40771258

entry.title: [FspCache] Introduce ContentLRUCache to retain a list of items
entry.content:
An in-memory LRU cache will be used to retain the recency of files as

they are written to the disk as well as retrieved from the disk. This

will enable eviction of the files when space needs to be reclaimed.



The underlying data structure will be a std::unordered_map with the hash

key being the std::string representation of a base::FilePath. This

enables O(1) lookup so the actual data pertaining to the file will be

stored here as well.



For now there is not much additional complexity added against the LRU

cache except allowing for it to be initialized from state. This is to

enable the state of cached files to be initialized in their LRU order

without starting from scratch again.



Bug: b/317137739

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=FileSystemProviderContentLRUCacheTest*

Change-Id: I64a51380707a3ff35f642d6aab0da5148a8f7946

entry.title: Re-enable Abseil flags support in GoogleTest.
entry.content:
While Abseil now supports a GTEST_NO_ABSL_FLAGS define, and Chrome could

simply set that define (once the corresponding GoogleTest version is

rolled in), there are other third-party test projects that need to use

parts of Abseil not normally allowed in Chrome, e.g. fuzztest's

Centipede. This serves as a proof-of-concept to validate the overall

approach.

entry.title: Make PaintRecordBuilder stack allocated
entry.content:
It's always used temporarily, but it was not stack allocated because

it implemented DisplayItemClient which requires the implementors to be

garbage collected.



The only scenario where PaintRecordBuilder was used as

DisplayItemClient was recording the target links in printing. Now use

StaticDisplayItemClient there so that PaintRecordBuilder no longer

needs to implement DisplayItemClient.
